posts.content:
Hi all,

We`re looking for our first splitty to use as a weekend driver/full camper. Don`t mind taking on a project but we are novices and wary of biting off more than we can chew. A blank canvas/empty interior is fine as we have lots of ideas of how we`d want to fit it out. We are thinking 11/13/15 windows and are open to the idea of German or Brazilian buses.
We are fully prepared to do work on the bus but will be over time as monthly funding allows. We`re really thinking the budget would be ~Â£500/month ongoing to bring the bus up to scratch and not in any particular hurry.

Budget wise we`re looking at 10-12K but could push a little further for the right bus. Likewise the Brazilian project we missed on the SSVC facebook page at 5K would have been doable too (as would have left a decent budget chunk for more significant work).

Anyone have anything of interest? We are based in Stockport/Manchester but would be willing to travel.

Cheers,

Rich and Anna.

Try the og paint bus ratty mullet ( si) has on here for sale, all solid where it needs to be and og paint and its a German built bus, he has sold a few bus's on here and other sites and everybody involved seems happy so might be worth a try, plus you won't be buying blind as he is a bus man, nothing to do with me the sale just want to point you in the right direction

Come and take a look at my 66
Neil has a guy in Manchester who takes on any body work needed to suit what you want
Can deliver over to you

Grant

I'd agree, Ratty Mullet (Si) a good call - he's darn Sarf.

You spoke to the guys at Schofields in Glossop (local to you too)? they will know of some projects or could source one I bet - they are more for parts, but guys are VW people.

http://www.alanhschofield.com/

Or Kieft N Klok, email Nol (Arnold) there - tell him Mark at Boardriderstickers.com sent you , they source lot of US buses, so you could specify what work you wanna do and a budget, they could look. Granted they put a bit on, but it is their living. Also ship bus to Hull from Netherlands.

http://www.kieftenklok.nl/index.php?lang=UK&section=1&ani=light#article_589

All sorted now, many thanks for the help so far....

Much more will be needed, resto thread starting imminently...and kindly forget the comment about biting off more than we can chew
